meanings.definition: To release from confinement or restraint.
meanings.sent1: The key unfrees the bird from the cage.
meanings.sent2: The kind person unfrees the trapped cat from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The magician unfrees the rabbit from the hat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile unfrees the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight unfrees the flowers from the frost.

meanings.sent1: The hero unfrees the villagers from the evil sorcerer's spell.
meanings.sent2: The activists work to unfree the oppressed people from tyranny.
meanings.sent3: The genie unfrees the trapped prince from the lamp.
meanings.sent4: Music has the power to unfree emotions we keep hidden.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind unfrees the kite to soar high in the sky.

meanings.sent1: Education can unfree the mind from ignorance.
meanings.sent2: The new law aims to unfree businesses from unnecessary regulations.
meanings.sent3: The artist unfrees creativity from the boundaries of tradition.
meanings.sent4: Love has the ability to unfree us from our fears.
meanings.sent5: The breakthrough technology unfrees us from old ways of thinking.
